questions.question: What is the measure of central tendency that represents the middle value in a sorted dataset?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle value when data is arranged in order, dividing it into two equal halves.

questions.question: Which measure shows how spread out the data values are from the mean?
questions.explanation: Standard deviation quantifies the amount of variation or dispersion in a dataset.

questions.question: What type of graph uses bars to show the frequency distribution of continuous data?
questions.explanation: Histograms display frequency distributions using adjacent bars for continuous data ranges.

questions.question: What is the most frequently occurring value in a dataset called?
questions.explanation: The mode is the value that appears most often in a dataset.

questions.question: Which correlation coefficient indicates a perfect positive linear relationship?
questions.explanation: A correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a perfect positive linear relationship between variables.

questions.question: What percentage of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean in a normal distribution?
questions.explanation: In a normal distribution, approximately 68% of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean.

questions.question: Which statistical test is used to determine if there is a significant difference between two group means?
questions.explanation: A t-test compares the means of two groups to determine if they are statistically different.

questions.question: What is the square of the standard deviation called?
questions.explanation: Variance is the average of squared deviations from the mean and equals the square of standard deviation.

questions.question: Which value divides a dataset into four equal parts?
questions.explanation: Quartiles divide data into four equal parts, with Q1, Q2, and Q3 marking the divisions.

questions.question: What type of probability distribution is bell-shaped and symmetric?
questions.explanation: The normal distribution is a symmetric, bell-shaped curve centered around the mean.
